repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: To prevent #30986 and #31198 regression update inspect_tree tests.

comment_data.body:
use full command names in code. helps when searching for usages. same for the rest of this file
```suggestion
    n.command('edit ' .. name)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -120,22 +120,24 @@ describe('vim.treesitter.inspect_tree', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates source and tree buffer windows and closes them correctly', function()
+    local name = t.tmpname()
+    n.command('e ' .. name)

@@ -120,22 +120,24 @@ describe('vim.treesitter.inspect_tree', function()
   end)
 
   it('updates source and tree buffer windows and closes them correctly', function()
+    local name = t.tmpname()
+    n.command('e ' .. name)
     insert([[
       print()
       ]])
+    n.command('set filetype=lua | w')
 
     -- setup two windows for the source buffer
     exec_lua(function()
       _G.source_win = vim.api.nvim_get_current_win()
-      vim.api.nvim_open_win(0, false, {
+      _G.source_win_copy = vim.api.nvim_open_win(0, false, {

comment_data.body: Of the window above `source_win`. Maybe `copy` isn't the best name, because it is simply another window displaying the source buffer.

comment_regular_data.body: This isn't correct. It leads to a `No write since last change` error.

> This isn't correct. It leads to a `No write since last change` error.

I know that occurs. It's because the content on the buffer isn't saved. 

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c6ba0607384ee5609add4676b1e86e03601ce230/test/functional/treesitter/inspect_tree_spec.lua#L123-L125

I thought of saving the buffer contents, and after removing the file but it felt wrong. Another approach would be to split this into a simpler test without buffer contents. What do you think?

> You can use `n.expect_exit(n.command, 'q!')`

I believe that ignores the error `E855: Autocommands caused command to abort` all together.
Are you worried about https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c6ba0607384ee5609add4676b1e86e03601ce230/test/functional/treesitter/inspect_tree_spec.lua#L170

masking other possible errors ? If that is the case I could do a equality check with `No write since last change` error.

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/treesitter/inspect_tree_spec.lua b/test/functional/treesitter/inspect_tree_spec.lua
index 2d3b7101d8..9749f75119 100644
--- a/test/functional/treesitter/inspect_tree_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/treesitter/inspect_tree_spec.lua
@@ -167,7 +167,7 @@ describe('vim.treesitter.inspect_tree', function()
 
     -- close source buffer window and all remaining tree windows
     feed(':q<CR>')
-    t.neq('E855: Autocommands caused command to abort', n.api.nvim_get_vvar('errmsg'))
+    t.eq('E162: No write since last change for buffer "[No Name]"', n.api.nvim_get_vvar('errmsg'))
     eq(false, exec_lua('return vim.api.nvim_win_is_valid(tree_win_copy_1)'))
     eq(false, exec_lua('return vim.api.nvim_win_is_valid(tree_win_copy_2)'))
   end)
  ```
@zeertzjq Sorry for the ping, but what do you think? The tests now cover the previously mentioned fixes and the error isn't masked like it previously was.
@zeertzjq I found the function `t.tmpname()` to write to a temporary file. I believe everything should be according to expectations.

title: test(treesitter): update inspect_tree tests
